name: homophonic

homophonic adjective
(MUSIC)
Add to word list
Add to word list
music
  specialized consisting of only one tune or part that is played or sung, or several parts that are played or sung in harmony (= with different notes being played or sung at the same time) with the main melody, and often also in the same rhythm, or relating to or producing such a sound: In real music, simple homophonic chords in which all the notes sound together happen only rarely. The orchestra began with slow, homophonic music in dotted rhythms. Compare
polyphonicSynonym
chordalRelated word
homophony

homophonic adjective
(LANGUAGE)
language
  specialized (of words) pronounced the same, but having a different meaning, or a different spelling and meaning: Context is key for the understanding of homophonic words. The study found that homophonic phrases were more of a problem for readers than had previously been thought. The words "so", "sow", and "sew" are homophonic. Related words

homophony
